sentence.Network_en: Judging the legality of the ordinance is within the province of the courts.
sentence.Network_cn: 判决这条法令是否合法是由法院来决定的.

sentence.Network_en: The French Foreign Legion was founded by a Royal Ordinance, written on a small piece of official Prench War Office notepaper dated March 9 th, 1931.
sentence.Network_cn: 法国外籍兵团是按照皇家的一项法令建立的, 这项法令记录在一小页法国陆军部公函信笺上, 日期是1931年3月9日.

sentence.Network_en: South Carolina passed an " ordinance of secession ", and prepared for war.
sentence.Network_cn: 南卡罗来纳州通过了 “ 脱离联邦法令 ”, 准备打仗.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'arrangement in ranks'): from Old French ordenance, from medieval Latin ordinantia, from Latin ordinare 'put in order' (see ordain)

entry.def: An ordinance is an official rule or order.

means.word_mean: 2. a statute enacted by a city government
3. the act of ordaining; the act of conferring (or receiving) holy orders;

sentences.sentence: "the rabbi's family was present for his ordination"

stems_affixes.word_buile: co共同+ordin顺序+ate表动词,也表示形容词→顺序一样→同等的,引申为平等;协调
in无+ordin命令,顺序+ate……的→无顺序的→过度的
in不+subordinate服从的→adj.不服从的,反抗的
ordin命令,顺序+al……的→adj.顺序的,依次的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 普通的,平凡的,平常的;平庸的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ordin命令,顺序+ary……的→有顺序的;听命令的→普通的
sub下面,副手+ordin顺序+ate……的→顺序在下→附属的
coordinate[v.协调 adj.同等的;座标]+or人→n.协调者,同等的人或物
ordin命令,顺序+ance表名词→命令[状态]→法令
